Positive Reviews: Location was great and very central making it very easy to get around. The included breakfast was nice. The room was comfortable. The hostel staff were also very friendly and organized events making it easy to meet other travelers.

Review Title: Warm welcome and privacy are highly appreciated! I can wait to be back!
Negative Reviews: The location was a little bit off for me, but not the hostel's fault. It's a bit weird to walk around, but I must say it was very convenient being able to walk (during the day) to the Bean and Millennium Park.
Positive Reviews: I really loved the curtains to each bunk bed! I value privacy and this was a very good surprise! I've stayed in other locations of HI USA Hostels and Chicago was a great surprise also with the shared spaces and nice breakfast! I only stayed for 1 night, but would most def come back for more.

Negative Reviews: Size of the room was quite small and felt a bit cramped with a 6 yr old child who wanted to play in a morning before breakfast, nowhere to store suitcases etc so they took up most of the floor space
Positive Reviews: Loved the location for access to the museums etc, food and recreation area was fab

Review Title: Overall, a great stay and would definitely stay again.
Negative Reviews: Only complaint is the lack of bathrooms. Not enough and also the shower is in the same room as the only toilet in the dorm area so you can’t use it if someone is in the shower.
Positive Reviews: Great location! Close to public transit and easy to get everywhere. Breakfast was great! Beds were comfy and room was spacious.

Review Title: Perfect place for small tour in Chicago
Negative Reviews: We got a share bathroom
Positive Reviews: Free breakfast and nice stuff

Review Title: Surprising welcome, I would stay there again
Negative Reviews:
* The room was so cold and I could barely sleep on the first night - and talking with women in other rooms, I heard the same complain. But I asked for an extra blanket at the reception and they promptly gave me one, solving the problem.
* Before arriving, I had inquired if I could send something to be delivered to the hostel. They said yes, but only when I was retrieving the package I found that I had to pay a fee (US$3) for this. Maybe I overlooked this information in the rules, but anyway, I was sad that they did not inform me of the fee when I asked about the possibility of sending a delivery.
* Not the hostel's fault, but someone ate my food! They have stickers where you are supposed to put your name and check-in/out date before storing any food in the kitchen - what I found was great! so imagine my surprise when I arrived one night almost all my cereal and milk were gone.
     - side note: the kitchen was a mess! I understand that it was the guests' responsibility to clean their dishes, but it looks like no one did and the sink was overflowing with dirty utensils
Positive Reviews: The room was huge, all the beds had privacy curtains, individual lights, and a locker big enough to store a piece of hand luggage. The bathroom had shampoo, conditioner, and soap. Each person has an individual card that opens their room, bathroom, and floor at the elevator - which I found gave me a feeling of safety. The hostel is near bus stops and metro stations, and you can walk to Millennium Park.

For an Hostel, I would say it's very good. There are plenty of choices for breakfast and my room was very quiet. Located in the city centre, the hostel is within walking distance of all the city's attractions. I strongly recommend.

Negative Reviews:
Terrible absolutely horrid breakfast. Yogurt and granola is plenty but the green bananas and inedible granola and stale bread...
Just spend some money on breakfast or don't do it all
Positive Reviews: Great location and available all night. Tolerable rates

Negative Reviews: Noise from otside mostly trains and noise thrugh thin walls.
Positive Reviews: Price, location, cleanliness, and breakfast .

Negative Reviews: gets cold sometimes and the central airconditioning could be turned down a little during these times. I had a roommate whose nose kept blocking due to this and my feet were so cold I had to wear a pair of socks and wrap them with the towels provided as well as cover my face before I could sleep
Positive Reviews: spacious room, lockers in room, lounge and inclusive breakfast

Negative Reviews: Noise of passing trains
Positive Reviews: The location and the price

Negative Reviews: The breakfast was just okay, but it was complimentary!
Positive Reviews: The location was AMAZING. Beds and other accommodations were great, especially given the price. The staff was pleasant and accommodating, and I loved the opportunities to be social provided by the hostel.

Review Title: Perfect for a quick jaunt into Chicagoland
Negative Reviews: Though I personally felt safe and never concerned, it you arrive at the hostel at night, there will likely be unhoused residents taking up shelter outside under the overhang of the building as you approach it for the night. More reason we need to work on social supports and affordable housing etc but just informing other solo travelers that they are there and you are safe.
Positive Reviews:
I stayed here for a brief overnight. There were severe weather storms and tornados that impacted my travel home. I decided that instead of fighting it and staying at the airport, I might as well enjoy Chicago. So I took the train into town from the airport and was able to get here easy in less than an hour. Front desk staff were available 24/7, and they have very secure and clean facilities. They coordinate events around town, and the people who stay here are so kind, inclusive, and friendly. 

Delicious breakfast and ability to store luggage until your flight out made it very simple for me. I was able to return to the hostel and get right back on the train to the Airport with minimal strain. 

I think this is a great place, well worth it's money and easy to connect and make acquaintances to go explore the city with. (I was on a solo mission to get the energy of the town more than see the sights myself)

Thank you to the staff who helped me and kept me safe through multiple tornados and severe weather storms that hit town. Pretty cool trip.

Review Title: Comfortable stay in a great location
Negative Reviews: The room was very cold during the night. Only one functioning shower stall and bathroom stall in the women’s restroom by my room. But even so I didn’t have an issue with long waits so it was okay.
Positive Reviews: Great location, complimentary breakfast, everything was very clean. I was in a 10-bed but the room still felt spacious and the curtains in the bed were nice for a sense of privacy. Nice shared spaces on the property for working, eating, etc.

Negative Reviews: The only thing we didn't like is the size of the 'full size' bed which left us confused to start with. Even though it was comfortable enough, it would be nice to elaborate more on what the full size bed means as for us Europeans this is not a term we use.
Positive Reviews: At first we didn't realize we booked into a hostel private room with shared bathroom. However, the whole property management and facilities where excellent. The hostel is in an amazing location, easy to walk around downtown. It was great to have complementary breakfast everyday and new fresh towels upon request. Bathroom was always quiet and other room guests very respectful.

Review for the 10 bed female room for 4 nights.

Review Title: Great location close to the big sights and transportation.
Negative Reviews: Unlike my last visit, this time I had a room facing the train tracks next to the building (If my previous room was facing them, I've forgotten).  If the windows could be a little thicker to block out the noise, it'd be great.I quickly got used to the noise though and didn't need to use earplugs at all.
Positive Reviews:
Quick check-in. The front desk loaned me a fan as well since my room felt pretty warm.
It's very quiet, even in the common areas.
The location is great.  Right next to the library, only about 20 mins walking from Union Station, 5-7 min. walk to the Art Institute and about 20-24 mins from the Field Museum.
If you want to take public transportation, there's the trains running next to the hostel and bus stops less than a block away as well.
It's a clean, no-frills kind of place.
I had a private double. In the room in addition to the bed, was a small wall desk and chair.  In a small alcove, there were extra sheets, towels and an ironing board with iron. I liked the tall windows and extra tall ceiling I had. Lots of natural light.
The bed was firm but still a little soft.  I had no trouble sleeping through the night.
I didn't take part in any of the group programs or tours offered or use the laundry room so I can't comment on those.
The breakfast is pretty basic.  Bagels, croissants, bread, oatmeal and cereals for the most part.  Nothing extravagant but good to get you going in the morning.
When I got there, one elevator was out of service and the button wouldn't stay lit when pressed so I thought the other elevator was down as well so I climbed the stairs to the 7th floor with my backpack on.  I just needed to be patient. The other elevator was up and running by the next afternoon so the wait time drastically decreased.

Negative Reviews:
Lockers are inconveniently located inside sleeping areas. Since there is a secured common area for each block of rooms, lockers should be located in these common areas so that people don’t have to wake each other up while opening/closing/shuffling through their loud metal lockers. 
Also, their computer system is not secure. The hostel’s booking system was hacked and a credit card confirmation request was sent out to guests through the Booking.com system. Since the message came through the Booking platform, I clicked on it, let the auto fill input my credit card info, and clicked enter, but realized that the processing bar (and the wording of the request) were too suspicious and clicked out, but since I’d already entered my CC info, I had to cancel that credit card and have a new one issued. 
Otherwise, it’s a nice place with nice personnel, cool interiors, free breakfast, and in a great location.

Positive Reviews: Pros: One of the awesome experiences I had ever with hostels. This hostel is really nice for location it located in Chicago downtown with access to the public transportations, grocery stores, restaurants and cafés. It came with 7 floors building with modern interior design, it's a small apartment with two bedrooms, dining table, kitchen, shower and toilet also there's many facilities such microwave, hair dryer, tissues and towels. Reception staff is friendly, helpful and professional once the rooms are ready they let you check in early even if in the morning. The breakfast is good for the quality also for free and there's open kitchen if you want to make your own meals. Beds are good and always clean. The security system for the building is very good, that's why it's safe. There's a laundry room and washing machines at the 7 floor. The cost of accommodation is very reasonable compared to others hostels in such area. There's a dig setting hall at the second floor for internment and chilling. Overall rating is 09/10.
The breakfast was really good.

Positive Reviews: Easy to get to/from Chicago O'Hare Airport via the Blue Line with only 5 minutes walking to the hostel. The Red Line close, too. Also, a 20 minute walk to Union Station (Amtrak and other trains). Great location in the loop. Big 10 bed dorm with storage locker big enough to fit my big suitcase by the bed. The mattress was very comfortable with a light and an electrical socket in easy reach. Also a curtain. Very clean room and bathrooms. Staff friendly and helpful. Free activities. Places to sit comfortably at sofas or tables with electrical sockets nearby in the common areas. Nice breakfast. LGBTQ+ friendly.

Review Title: Solid choice for Chicago Marathon runners
Negative Reviews: Staff keeps everything tidy but the facilities have seen some wear and tear.
Positive Reviews: Perfect location for anyone running the Chicago Marathon - about a five-minute walk to the start corrals and ten minutes from the finish line. The hostel seemed entirely occupied by runners. It was a heavily international crowd that skewed somewhat older. Everyone was very, very focused on their race resumes, running attire, etc.  On marathon weekend, it is total immersion in the budget-traveler, World Marathon Majors jet set.  The facilities themselves are somewhat basic but entirely acceptable for 48-72 hours. Was pleasantly surprised by how comfortable my bed was and the size of the four-person dorm room. Breakfast was simple but got the job done and staff was friendly.

The location and the safety aspect for a solo female  traveller

Review Title: overall a good clean place right in the loop
Negative Reviews:
There was a storm the evening of our arrival that knocked out the electricity to the pump for water and the ac. We were informed casually AFTER checkin and payment, and that it would be repaired in ‘40 minutes’. Well that was optimistic. The no ac would have been ok if they hadn’t bolted all the windowso completely shut. it was stifling. 
and in the morning there was still no water, and water bottles were locked up in an office. i had to demand water bottles for brushing teeth. toilets were essentially port-o-lets. it was gross. and it seemed there is a culture of ‘not my job’ as so many people were working, and no one filled some buckets with water from the ground floor to force flush anything. later, after 1pm, after the cleaning crew arrived, they were doing just that. no reason other team members didnt pitch in during the emergency situation. 
the new generator was being delivered at 2pm, a full 14 hours after that ‘40 minutes’. 
we did, however, get a full refund for the one-night stay. they would have saved 50% of that with some buckets and bottles of water. 
the front desk agent didn’t seem to know much at all by way of directions, how to use the metro, etc. surprising. 

our previous stay three weeks earlier was a lot better. we would return if in chicago again; crisis management and team building would be helpful here.

Very comfortable clean and nice! I stayed in one of the smaller dorm rooms, and it was suite-style -  two of these smaller, 4-bed dorm rooms shared a living room, bathroom, and kitchen. The suite I happened to be in spacious and the windows were huge and gorgeous. Not much in the way of furniture (lockers, a single bench in the dorm room, and a table and some armchairs in the living room) but the beds were fine and comfy and each had a little curtain for privacy. I just think it was very serviceable.

The trains were right outside the window, which says how good a location it was in, but also as some other people have pointed out it DOES get loud. But it's not like raucous partying loud, just the occasional deep thundery rumble kinda loud, which I personally found nice but your mileage may vary.

Review Title: well located hostel with clean facilities and free breakfast!
Positive Reviews: the hostel is very well located, close to most of the things you would like to do in Chicago. the facilities are very good and clean. the free breakfast was amazing and I took advantage of it every day. I only wish the coffee would be better. The staff was very nice and helpful.

Negative Reviews:
l did not like all renovations:  They took down the closet space in the 4 bed room..lts more spacious now  but where do you hang your coat in fall or that nice dress?..(lockers have hooks..right..no!) 
They also used to have a desk or two in the room ..now only a sitting bench..ok no big deal its hard to share desk anyway.  Lastly, you arrive late at night and you will find towels and only a bed sheet in your bed...if you want a blanket ..you will have to go all the way down to reception to get it. This is a cost saving tactic..some people don't need a blanket..it saves on washing. 
The temperature in the room was fine in summer..but most folks may need a blanket..get one downstairs on your way up.

 If you a light sleeper you will be bothered by the hostels location right next to the elevetated train.  It is quiet noisy in the early morning.
Positive Reviews:
I have been coming to this hostel for years..After covid l have been staying in private rooms..this time l shared a  "premium" 4 bed room in a suite..so up to 8 females share a bathroom (think dorm style) ..l was pleasantly surprised with the renovations.  The room was clean..new floors (no yucky carpet) and the bunk beds were new and sturdy no creaking..new curtains at each bed and night light. Most rooms have huge windows with easy to open/close blinds.

Breakfast is generous..hot oatmeal.. bread and pastries and hard boiled eggs(eggs mostly on weekdays not weekends.. l think)..cheese, butter and jam.. coffee and juice.  Of course you have access to fridges and use of a full kitchen.  I also liked that the international crowd is back!  Guest include  solo older travelers like myself,  youth groups and  families.  
Very nice hostel.. but remember.. Hostels are affordable because most rooms are shared or you share a bathroom...that is not for everyone..and your experience will vary depending if you and your roommates are nice and considerative of each other and the common space. I have had tons of great encounters...and a few bad ones.

Review Title: Back to normal!  I recommend for the budget traveler
Negative Reviews:
The cleaning staff should check the bathrooms sinks daily..they clog often.. Please don't wait for the guest to tell you..in fact, most will not.

The hostel used to have trash cans in the single rooms.. a single trash can and a recycling bin  in the common kitchen does not cut it.. really,!

Unfortunately, in the pandemic aftermath the hostel is still using disposable plates, cups and utensils... Staff  shortage may be part of it. Let's  hope the hostel returns to sustainability..reusable breakfast wear.
Positive Reviews:
Finally!  l can say the hostel is pretty much back to normal since the covid pandemic! .l can see a return to a mix of travelers male and females  and they have activities for guests..
l travel for work on my own dime. I am a solo female traveler over 50.  l have been coming here now and then for over 10 years so l have seen the ups and downs .. Note this is a hostel not a hotel ..mainly, you will find just the basics bunk beds or double bed, towel,  chair and  table.. and mostly shared rooms or single rooms with shared bathroom depending on price. If sharing is ok with you ..this hostel is a great value in a great location and staff is nice.

Continental breakfast is great and includes pastries, bread,  cheese and oatmeal (hard boiled eggs are offered sometimes but not on weekends) l like to bring my own ham or fresh fruit to compliment what they offer. Premium suites include a common fridge or you can use the ones in the main kitchen.
Things are looking up ..l can again recommend this hostel for the budget traveler who is either young or young at heart.

Positive Reviews: HI Chicago Hostel is a "hostel" - not a hotel.  The facilities were extremely basic, but we were okay.  The room was very small but essentially clean.  The shared bathroom could have been cleaner - someone left dirty clothes and towels on the floor, which weren't cleaned up in two days.  The furniture was worn.  But we weren't expecting a luxury hotel.  This was fairly adequate for the price and location.  The breakfast was really basic (bagels, rolls, cream cheese, cereal, milk, orange juice, etc.).  Extra note - sadly, there are homeless people sleeping on the sidewalk near the hostel.  But we felt safe (maybe it would have been different if one of us had been alone).  I would consider staying here again if similar circumstances.  A pretty good value, but be prepared.  The front desk staff was very friendly.

Review Title: Overall amazing, will definitely use again
Negative Reviews:
It is understandable that things can be out of service at times, but having the hot water machine break down during my stay (Nov) was not the best experience. Also, the laundry room for guests was out of service, which was pretty frustrating.

Another thing that could be better is having bigger lockers as the dorm rooms certainly have enough space. Still this is just something that would be nice to have, the lockers are pretty standard hostel size.
Positive Reviews:
The location is great. A dorm room is definitely among the cheapest accomodations in the area and works perfectly. 

The dorms are more like little apartments, at least the 4 bed female dorms are. There is a little common room, 2 rooms with 4 beds each, a disabled kitchen (only microwave works) and there is a bathroom for the 8 beds, 2 sinks with mirrors (independent from bathroom).

The safety measures will make you for sure feel at ease. You have to use your room key to get into the building at night. You have to use your key to operate the elevators at all times. You have to use your room key to get into your dorm and to get into the room you have your bed in.

Public transportation is pretty easy to get to. There is police presence at all times, specially at night. You are where all the architecture tours will take you, literally you will walk around the hotel in some of them. 

Staff was very nice and accommodating. You can get blankets, extra towels and clean sheets anytime you ask for them on the check in counter.

The kitchen staff was specially nice and patient with sleepy people like me. This is in the second floor, where they serve continental breakfast.

On the first floor, they have a common area where people can play pool table, a comfy sofa for people to relax. projector to watch sports events.

They also had a free breakfast and many food options. I really like the breakfast. what I most like is the view from the lobby and kitchen, we could see subway tracks and trains going by when having breakfast. you can refill the water bottle.

The room was pretty clean and decent. there was a living room and a shared kitchen and bathroom toilet and then two rooms with 4 beds in each. I liked it compare to the NYC hostel where bathrooms were common on each floor.

The location was in the perfect area. like in the centre of downtown. everything is quite close.

Positive Reviews: Great location near metro L train ( all lines) in the corner of Millenium park (at Buckingham Fountain). Wifi free in all hotel. Good Breakfast included. Coffe and cream and hot water available all the time. Snack and food machine. Full kitchen available to use at 2nd floor. Small kitchen and Laundry available per floor. They received and kept your order. Have Lockers. You can wait your Checkin/Checkout in the 2nd floor in the  cafeteria. Cuban bar aside front desk. Room is Clean. Shared Bathroom and shared shower cleaned somehow.  14 days per year are the max stay duration. Nice staff. Hotel is a respectful place for family, without noise and party.
There always a good reservation there, excelent location near by Millennium Park. I recomend.

the location of the hostel is amazing in the heart of Chicago, also they offer nice breakfast and good facilities in the common area like ping bong it is overall very clean and accessible place to stay. 
Finally shout out to the girl who where in the reception 28th August around 2 pm she is short and burnet i think  i love how she was taking her work very seriously and professionally while she was always smiling when she is greeting a guest thank you.

It is not an hotel, and that should keep that in mind. But for a hostel, it is really good. Specially the dinning room, or whatever one can call it. For me, that was the best. Light, spacious, one could sit there and work, read, eat own food, talk to others. The kitchen is superb, enormous, and has all the equipment one might need. I stayed first at a 8 beds room, but we where only 4. That was really good. Another day I stayed at a 10 bed room (my mistake when booking) and that was not as good, but mainly because one of the guest just did not thought about the rest of us and started making noise a 6 am. It is clean, but it is an old building where a lot of people come and go. So of course it is a bit... well, could have a fresher look. But considering the price, there is nothing to complain about.

Positive Reviews: I had the 4 bed female dorm. Between the 4 of us we had a separate kitchen, living room, wash basins area and shower/toilet. Each bed in the bunk had its own power socket and light. Also, there is a ladder to the top bunk (something the HI San Francisco Fisherman's Wharf could do with). Plus there's a nice Mexican cafe on the ground floor. This place is fantastic, there's no question about that. If you need any supplies, the CVS pharmacy across the road has it all - food, toiletries and electrics. Thank you HI Chicago. I'll be back!

Positive Reviews: The location is fantastic for visiting areas in and around the Loop, and it's easy to connect to the Metro to get to farther-out places. The bed was very comfortable, the room/shared bathroom was clean, and the main lounge area was spotless. My room was on the top floor in the corner furthest from the metro rails, so while I did hear the train go by, it wasn't any more disruptive than regular big city noises. I also appreciated the vending machines with snacks and microwavable meals-- and ice cream!-- and the free coffee in the main kitchen area. And I was glad to have use of the storage lockers the day I checked out (so I could do a little more sightseeing before I left). Overall, I really enjoyed my stay here and would come back again.

Rooms aren’t cleaned often. Refrigerator had food that was over a month old. Dorm room hadn’t been swept in a while so I grabbed a broom and swept it myself.

Review Title: Some snags, but overall a good stay.
Negative Reviews:
When I checked in I was assigned a bunk that was already occupied. No problem. The lady at the front desk moved me to a different room. I soon noticed that my new bunk lacked a privacy curtain. When I went down and asked for one I was offered.....a bed sheet. Lady said they were out of curtains. 

Also noticed that they don't switch out the matress cover after each guest. They could easily be washed with the sheets.....
Positive Reviews: Comfy bunks. Shower was hot. Regular cleaning. Excellent location. Nice common areas. Staff was friendly. Just keep your personal items secured and in your own space and you'll be fine.

Negative Reviews: Have no idea how often the shared bathrooms are cleaned, but every morning in the shower I was finding cone hairs, and they were definitely mine
Positive Reviews:
The location is great. Easy to get from the airport by Blue lain. Close to the center.
Using cards to enter everywhere, give some feeling of protection (so only people that have cards can enter the building/ the floor/the shared space/the room).

Negative Reviews: The kitchens had no utensils or pots and pans. They told me it was because of Covid. Would have been nice to know ahead of time. Also it seems quite over the top, if people want to cook let them cook and be responsible. They should give a discount because of that.
Positive Reviews: Room was pretty comfortable, facilities were in good condition. Has the potential for a great time if you are with a group, however I was alone and had the feeling that the place was pretty empty. The cafe next door was great.

Review Title: Great and affordable place to make new friends and explore Chicago.
Negative Reviews: The rooms are always freezing. There might be a reason for the low room temperature but it was very cold always.
Positive Reviews: It’s so easy to make friends and hang out with new people. The hostel is located close to the lake and almost every tourist place.

Hotels are expensive in this area of Chicago and HiHostel is a great way of staying in the central part of Chicago without paying a top price. Mostly young people, but there guests of all ages so customers who are above 30 or families do not have to feel out of place. The hostel works with volunteers who organize city walks and staff the information centre. Basic interior but clean.

Negative Reviews: Homeless outside the building, long line at the front desk, luggage store for a fee.

Review Title: A great place to stay in Chicago !
Negative Reviews:
There are not many dishes that can be put in the microwave because the plates are not microwave-safe. There should be a cupboard with boxes that can be labelled for storing dry food (bread, etc...), as there is in other hostels. There should be hooks in the rooms for towels. 
Some mornings the staff provide reusable crockery for breakfast and on other days disposable crockery. I don't understand why. That's better to use reusable dishes.
Sometimes the rooms are too expensive.
Positive Reviews: Breakfast was very good (there were sweet and savoury). The lockers are big. There is a kitchen on each floor (the kitchen on the second floor is the best equipped, there was everything to cook). The location in the loop is perfect.

Negative Reviews:
-The locker is not big enough to store a big baggage, and the padlock is not included but can be bought in the structure.
-I explictly asked for a gluten free breakfast but there was nothing I could eat apart from fruit. I would have appreciated some gluten free biscuits or bread. I had to buy my breakfast instead.
Positive Reviews: The position is perfect to visit the center of Chicago. I appreciated the cleanliness of the structure and the possibility to join free tours of the city organized by volunteers.

Negative Reviews: It isn't a bad neighborhood per se since State Street is one of the busiest streets in Chicago, but you should be vigilant if you go out at night, particularly as a solo female traveler. I saw a few drunk people on the street and it did get quiet past 10 PM but it was a weekday.
Positive Reviews: The hostel is good. The rooms and bathroom are clean and having curtains attached to bunk beds helps those with privacy concerns. The breakfast was fine too. I also liked that they provided each room with a kitchenette.

The top bunk bed in a private room that has one larger and one smaller bed is a little difficult to get on (there are no handles at the top) and there is no shelf/space to keep some stuff on. Also, get a longer charger if you want to have your phone next to you at night (the socket is on the floor).
Positive Reviews: It's my second stay and it was as good as the first one. Unlike other Chicago hostels, this one is very clean, and spacious, has nice stuff, and even offers breakfast. The location is great. If you stay in a private room with a shared bathroom which might get busy, you may use the one on the floor outside of your unit (it's very spacious and private).

Positive Reviews: Location is amazing. It's walking distance to downtown. Also it was nice places to go and visit nearby. I like the relaxation lobby in the second floor. Good to chill after a busy day doing tourism.

Negative Reviews: Given this is the land of lawsuits, it's understandable that they have a liability waiver (though many smaller hostels I stayed in the States don't have it, guess they couldn't afford lawyers, unlike this one). It left a bad first impression nonetheless, as if you went to a restaurant and the first thing they served was a waiver for all food poisoning liabilities. And the way their staff handled it didn't help either. Their reply, when asked some questions, was basically it's what it's, take it or leave it. They lacked the common warm feeling in hospitality service, and were more like bureaucrats - polite enough in interactions, but grudgingly. Their price was comparable to most American hostels I stayed at but that also means it is more expensive than the global rate. Wifi signal in the kitchen area was fine but if your room is far from it then signal strength would drop significantly
Positive Reviews: I stayed in a dorm and, facilities wise, it was one of the best hostels I stayed at. It was a 10-bed dorm but it was clean and very spacious (other hostels would make it 16 bed). My room has big windows so it gets lots of natural sunlight (but I guess most other rooms won't be similar as mine is at the end of the hallway). Everything wasn't brand new but certainly not dirty and worn out either. The bathroom also looked clean and well maintained.There is a common area with pool tables but not many people there. The location is very convenient for sightseeing as it's in the city center (or downtown as Americans called it) and 5-10 minutes walking for metro/bus stations.

Negative Reviews: Uncomfortable bed

Positive Reviews: Great location and efficient staff. Lovely room

Negative Reviews: Bathrooms would be found very dirty sometimes. And I think a homeless guy with a very bad smell would sleep in the room.

This happened while I already had reserved the place for another night and had just asked them to "switch" the dates for me so I wouldn't had to for the night I wasn't there. I contacted costumer service through Booking and they said I should follow-up with the hustle, however, the hustle staff directed me to the Booking too...

Positive Reviews: Pros: One of the awesome experiences I had ever with hostels. This hostel is really nice for location it located in Chicago downtown with access to the public transportations, grocery stores, restaurants and cafés. It came with 7 floors building with modern interior design, it's a small apartment with two bedrooms, dining table, kitchen, shower and toilet also there's many facilities such microwave, hair dryer, tissues and towels. Reception staff is friendly, helpful and professional once the rooms are ready they let you check in early even if in the morning. The breakfast is good for the quality also for free and there's open kitchen if you want to make your own meals. Beds are good and always clean. The security system for the building is very good, that's why it's safe. There's a laundry room and washing machines at the 7 floor. The cost of accommodation is very reasonable compared to others hostels in such area. There's a dig setting hall at the second floor for internment and chilling. Overall rating is 09/10.

Negative Reviews: No blankets, had to ask at the reception for one.

During our stay, the common areas were often occupied by groups of hispanic men who were there as if it was their own living room. Although we are all in for integration and support schemes, at first this may not be what you expect at a Hostel.
Positive Reviews: The Hostel is well located in the southern part of the Chicago Loop and is well connected by the L system. The breakfast has pretty much everything you need (if you arrive in time) and lovely views of the Chicago L. There's a TV, a snooker table and a ping-pong table in the common areas. The hostel offers some outdoor activities (although we were not able to fit any into our schedule).

Review Title: Affordable, safe, mostly clean place. Very central - a block from the Loop.
Negative Reviews:
There used to be a shared kitchen adjacent to the "living room" common area shared by 4 rooms, but the hostel decided to remove this "local" kitchen (except for the fridge and a cupboard) and just allow guests to cook in the big kitchen downstairs. But instead of removing the stove they just disconnected the power and left it there gathering dust/grease. They should make it into an office space or something else useful.
The adjacent building used to be some kind of institute which closed so the nearby sidewalk is somewhat dirty with homeless ppl sleeping. It's the reality in the downtown of many US cities though, sigh.

Review Title: Ok stay for a few nights
Negative Reviews: I messaged the staff and asked more than once how big the lockers were as I was switching from an hotel to the hostel with work equipment and the answer was “standard size”. I asked again if I could fit a trolley and same answer. The girls who were there seemed pretty careless. I had no towel the night I got there and they didn’t provide me with any until the day after. Breakfast ends at 9am which is pretty wack. The room was too cold and I heard the other girls complaining about it too and using towels to stay warmer.
Positive Reviews: I came here for 2 nights due to a large event happening and limited availability in the downtown area. I like that it’s in a central location and i’d say it’s safe during day time but wouldn’t walk alone at night as there are some creepy people around. I like that a key card is needed to enter. Overall it was clean for an hostel in the US and lockers would fit a medium size trolley and another small backpack.

Review Title: Exceptional. This hostel is tailor-made for young travelers.

Positive Reviews: This hostel is at a great location. Right at the center of downtown Chicago, it is a stone's throw away from Jackson Station (which can be directly accessed by the Blue Line from O'Hare Airport). It is also near to other major attractions like the Riverwalk, Art Institute, Buckingham Fountain and Navy Pier. The layout and amenities in the hostel were exceptional. The dorm rooms, bathroom and toilets were clean and sanitary. The common area and halls in the second floor had many amenities like board games, pool tables and comfortable seating area. The hostel is comfortable and spacious, and has a cooperative and friendly staff.

Review Title: OK for the price, OK for solo travel.
Negative Reviews: The hostel is too big and impersonal. The cost is excessive given the quality-price relationship. I had paid the same price for a boutique-luxury hostel in other global cities such as London, Paris, or Shanghai. Probably an American issue and not related to the hostel, but the area didn't feel safe with too many homeless people asking for money (most were polite though).
Positive Reviews: The room is very clean. The staff is professional and it seems everyone is trying their best every day. The location is premium and super easy to access from the airport. The breakfast is among the worst I've had in any hostel, but the staff were busy making sure it was the best, so I give them that.

Negative Reviews: The listing said the room would have 2 smart TVs and there wasn't a single TV of any kind in the entire suite. This mattered because we were traveling with a 1 and 3 year old and Grandpa was going to babysit while my husband and I went out at night and we were relying on him being able to play movies on the TV to entertain the kids. We also assumed we could watch the Bucks playoff game so we can back to the room to watch it and couldn't.
There was only one working toilet and shower on my floor for a dorm of 10. While the cost is comparable for the US, it is still expensive for a dorm bed.
Positive Reviews: Good location for downtown Chicago, with sights and restaurants in close proximity. Clean and comfortable, good breakfast, and with a lovely chill-out area. The free walking tour was also good.
Great events on every day

Review Title: Fun stay, and ask for a room away the train tracks.
Negative Reviews: One side of the hotel is close to train tracks. Fun to see the trains, but they run all night and are loud. Used earplugs at night and did not sleep well.
Positive Reviews: Location and cost were good. First time at Hostel, and it was fun to be with fellow travelers. Easy access to coffee was a plus.  Did feel secure and safe.

Review Title: Good for the location/convenience and downtown cost, but minimal.
Negative Reviews: Our room was *freezing*. I don't think there was any heat to it. The highs during our stay were mostly 30s-40s, and I suspect what little heat we had was just from heat elsewhere in the building. They offered us another room, but we didn't want to risk getting one without natural light, which was unappealing. (Someone else said their room was hot - go figure). The one bathroom for the four rooms in our group was small but sufficed for the few people there. I don't think our pod had any multi-bunk rooms. The shower was like a tomb though - very small and poorly lit. Also - I had looked forward to being able to use our group kitchen, but it was still disabled, with no dishes. Only the main second floor kitchen was functional.
Positive Reviews: Excellent location for what we needed (Auditorium Theater and blue line from O'Hare, also close to bus to the zoo and walkable to some other things). Breakfast was limited but okay. Felt safe/secure. Nice common areas. Provided plenty of pillows as well as extra blankets as needed. Clean room. We had an exterior room with windows (vs the center floor rooms).

Negative Reviews: The washrooms were very dirty and not even cleaned plus only one shower room on the floor .
Positive Reviews: The location was within the city and all the top attractions were within reach

The location is very good in downtown, close to train station, restaurants, and shops. The room wasn't that comfy, and bedsheets were not very clean. Rest rooms were very good and clean, though. Breakfast is excellent and free.

Review Title: Amazing location for a fun stay in Chicago
Negative Reviews: I wish there were rooms for groups of three, as we had to book an extra bed in a dorm to all fit. But once there, I think the room could have reasonably fit 3 people. I understand why that wasn't the case, but it would've been nice. It is a hostel so the bathroom is shared, we were lucky and this wasn't bad, but I imagine it could be uncomfortable during high season. Overall, though, no major complains.
Positive Reviews: The amenities are great! (We played board games and ping pong, but there were plenty of options). The breakfast is good and the beds are comfy. They even provide free lockers to store our bags before our departure, just bring a lock if you plan to use it. And the location is amazing, we could walk everywhere and explore Chicago easily! It was super convenient.

Review Title: a bit rundown, but the location is absolutely perfect!
Negative Reviews:
breakfast was very bad, they offer poor coffee, jam and cheese with stale break, blueberry muffins, cornflakes, oatmeal that is available before 9am only because they run out and dont make more. 

in general it needs better maintenance and upkeep, feels a bit rundown, messy, needs someone to take care of housekeeping, replacing broken furniture, improve the layout a bit, make it a bit more taken care of. feels like the management hasn’t visited the place in 20 years, just left it as is to operate by itself with reception staff alone, who are not authorized to change anything obviously. 

they limit your stay for two weeks so not sure why make people pay an $18 yearly membership in this hostel chain, is this a way to make more money for no valid reason (?) just add that to the overall room price, otherwise it makes it look like its cheaper than what it really is. 

its a bit too pricey for what it offers. but anyway, will do for a weekend.

Location, location, location! it’s literally in the center, you can walk everywhere. 

the nearest metro station is “Jackson”, 5 minute walk. its $5 straight to the airport on blue line, which is awesome! 

staff are nice, very helpful. 

you get a room with 5 more rooms in each apartment that has its own shared shower and bathroom, and pantry. there are more showers in the hallway. 

there are lockers for free if you have your own lock.

there’s a cafe called “Cafecito” on the ground level, which makes excellent sandwiches and coffee.

the building has access card security everywhere which makes it feel safe.

Review Title: Extra fee charged per night, not reflected in booking.com price.
Negative Reviews: The extra fee applied. HI Chicago is a property for members only apparently, if you are not a member you have to pay 4$ extra per night. That is very misleading since it is not reflected in the price before booking. I only came to know about it after booking my stay and receiving an email from the hostel. In my opinion this is not an honest policy and the reason I wouldn't recommend staying at this hostel. This should be clearly stated before booking and factored in the demonstrated price. After the booking is made, it is too late to inform the customer, since there are not really many practical choices on the customers side. Either the customer has to agree and pay the fee, which is an arbitrary amount and there is no guarantee that it will be low. The other option is to cancel the booking which will cost the customer an amount close to one night's stay, that can be a significant amount for some budgets. Please consider removing this fee or explicitly informing anyone interested up front. In my opinion it is a very insincere practice to obscure costs from the customers.

This hostel is fantastic. Big spaces, great breakfast. All the bunks have the foot of bed enclosed, a curtain for privacy and your own lamp and power outlet. The complementary breakfast was perfect, friendly staff and my entire stay was filled with good energy and good people. Special recognition to Management, front desk as well as housekeeping.

I have nothing but words of thanks. I made two requests for my arrival and the staff was able to help me. I can say that it is very well located. There are subway stations nearby and some restaurants. I went to Soldier Field and walked from the Hostel.

Positive Reviews: The location is perfect, just a couple of blocks away from the busy Downtown area, close to Grant Park and access to public transportation (bus stops at State St or L Train stops in Wabash St). We were surprised at how big the hostel was yet our mini suite for 2 people was within a "house-like" environment of only 4 suites/bedrooms, so it was actually quiet and very comfortable with a shared living room, kitchen and bathroom. For a hostel breakfast the options were more varied than we were expecting, and served in a prolonged time frame. There are at least 2 common areas that we saw, super big and nicely decorated, with pool tables and other games, high tables, lounge couches, etc. Staff was always very friendly, the amenities are very clean and well maintained. It's an incredible stay for the price!! I would definitely recommend and would go back to stay here. We could leave our suitcases for the entire last day, which was a huge favor since we were leaving the city at 7 pm. They only charge $4 per bag and we could go in to the restrooms before we left to freshen up and change before our trip back.

I was in walking distance to many downtown attractions and train stations as well as bus stations. This hostel must have been in the heart of Chicago. Also, Navy Pier was in walking distance if you're down for a bit of a walk. maybe 10 minutes of walking and you're right by it!

Positive Reviews:
location: amazing. close to trains, close to everything you would want to do downtown.
activities offered: so many options for everyone and ways to bring the guests together
breakfast: was simple, offered enough that you could fill up and feel satiated, but I would say it gets old rather quickly as theres not much variety
room: LOVE the blackout blind, thats a great touch. The only downsides were that the ac was blasting over top of my bed 24/7 and I was freezing. But they did give me a second blanket so that was very kind. 
The other suggestion I have would be to install a small wooden shelf or something between the base of the top bunk and the wall as when your upstairs bunk neighbor turns their light on at 1 am, it brightens up the bottom bunk as if its day time. The other reason for this is the person above me kept dropping their phone down the crack in the middle of the night and once it smacked me straight in the face. A barrier in this space would save many headaches for all lower bunk guests! 

Otherwise, amazing!

I was in Chicago to run the marathon and this place was PERFECT, breakfast was great (on race day you can have breakfast from 5:00 A.M.). Was a safe place and right in the city center. I was in room of 6 and it was very comfortable, spacious and clean.
I was there for 7 nights and honestly I have nothing to complain of.
Also, the price was great since during those days (because of the marathon) prices we super high even in other hostels that were not in the city center.

Positive Reviews: I was really Skeptical staying at a hostel. I had a lot of people telling me bad stuff about the idea of a hostel! But I loved it! Not only was the  location perfect. But honestly I felt safer here then any other hotel ￼have I ever stayed at they take a lot of extra precautions. You have to have a active key card to get into the building, to take the elevator, to use the bathroom and so on. Not only that but the shared living space even felt safe. You have to use a key to get int he shared living area and a key to get in to your private room. So, I really thought it was really safe and really cool place to experience the cultures of people that stay here. they also have this common area which is a really cool place to be around other people. The front desk was super nice and they even let us hold our bags after check out. Overall I loved the experience and definitely plan on recommending this place to everyone and staying here again. It was a really cool experience and different from places I usually stay at. It was a great  experience. I have stayed at a lot if places this is my new favorite great vibes! Also they are environmentally friendly and go through a lot of effort to use less. Like I said it was a great experience!! Will recommend  and stay again!

Review Title: Lovely hostel in the heart of Chicago! Great breakfast included
Negative Reviews: Everything was great
Positive Reviews: I loved how spacious the rooms, bathrooms and common areas were! I stayed in a 4-bed female dorm which was connected to a big shared kitchen, common room and a bathroom. 2 dorms share this space but the actual dorms can only be accessed by keycard so you don’t need to worry about your privacy! The breakfast buffet was really good and there’s a giant dining hall, kitchen and shared space with ping pong tables etc.

Negative Reviews:
I booked an 8-bed dorm room, but I ended up being the only guest. Unfortunately, the bathroom was quite dirty, which was disappointing in terms of hygiene. Considering I was the first guest in the room, I expected better cleanliness standards, even for a hostel. I informed the receptionist about the issue, and they suggested using the shared bathroom for the night since it was late. They assured me that housekeeping would clean it in the morning. However, nobody came to clean it the next day.
Also, I asked about the curtains on beds before booking to ensure privacy, and they confirmed they had them. However, upon arrival, I realized there were no curtains. Luckily, I was the only guest during my stay.
Positive Reviews: This was my first hostel experience, and I must say the front desk staff were incredibly kind and helpful. The location is fantastic, with most attractions within walking distance, and the metro station from the airport is conveniently close to the hostel. They also provide complimentary breakfast and offer free walking tours, which were extremely helpful.

The staff was so kind and the location was perfect for tourist things, late night dinner runs, and access to the train. There’s no free parking, but I kept my car in a lot down the street and it was only $90 for 4 nights which isn’t terrible. I stayed alone and felt so safe the whole time, especially with key card access being so enforced in every aspect of the building (needing it to get in the lobby, the elevator area, to the floor you were staying on, etc.). Overall one of my favorite places I have ever stayed - will be coming back in September!

To my surprise, the staff volunteered to walk with me to the subway the next day. I was so thankful what the staff has done for me.  I was so regret that I didn't ask staff's name and didn't give any tip as I didn't have change. Anyway, I would like to say aloud to the staff "Thank you very much,  You made my day!"  It was a very nice experience staying there.

Positive Reviews: Staff was very friendly and accommodating. The price is great and the location is perfect. A lot of the "postcard" tourist attractions are only a short walk away. I spent 5 nights in a deluxe full bed room with shared bathroom. I was traveling alone and in town for a music festival. Majority of the guests were festival goers. Although it's located in a busy area, it's very quiet inside. I never heard my neighbors except for when they were coming or going. There is a very comfortable community lounge area on the second floor with couches, pool tables, vending machines, and a large TV. There are multiple on site laundry facilities and a free breakfast every morning. Lots of stores, restaurants, and shops nearby. Conveniently located just blocks from the train. Great place to stay if you're a sociable traveler, but it also offers plenty of peace, quiet, and privacy for those who need to relax. I'll be a returning guest for sure.

Review Title: Excellent location! I would stay here again!
Negative Reviews:
Keep in mind most of the rooms have bunk beds. 
I was assigned a top bunk, which was difficult to get in and out of. Given that I’m a runner the situation wasn’t ideal before race day. (or any day actually) I knew there were bunks ahead of time. I was just crossing my fingers for a bottom bunk. 
If bunk beds aren’t your thing be certain to book a private room without bunks.
Positive Reviews: The property was clean, comfortable, and in an excellent location downtown. The beds were comfortable. There were kitchen facilities on our floor, including a fridge for food storage. Blankets are provided-just ask at check in. Luggage storage is offered before check in and after check out. Everything I needed was within walking distance, including several major landmark sites. The Van Buren train station was a 3 minute walk and the Loop train was one block away. I was there for the Chicago marathon. Entrance gates were 2 blocks away! A plus on chilly Chicago mornings!

Positive Reviews: The 4-bed female dorm on Level 5 had everything I needed. Each bed had a light, power supply and a good sized locker (remember to bring a padlock). My 4-bed dorm shared a kitchen, living room, shower and toilet, with another 4-bed female dorm. That was enough for 8 as most people don't hang around. There's also a communal shower and toilet on Level 5 for anyone to use. It wasn't until I left that I noticed that level 2 has a library, communal games/leisure area and a big kitchen. Perhaps the facilities on level 2 should be advertised more widely. When I checked out I was able to store my luggage in the lockers on ground floor (needed that padlock again). The Cafecito café on the ground floor is great, friendly staff and good food. I'll stay at HI Chicago again any day.

Negative Reviews: Due to the location being in downtown there are a lot of sirens at random hours of the night and the building is right next to the raised L-train tracks so if you're a light sleeper then maybe bring some earplugs or headphones, it didn't personally bother me but I know it might bother some people. Also due to it being downtown there are a few homeless people who roam around along that street, the hostel does a very good job of keeping them away from and outside of the hostel but if you aren't prepared the homeless people in Chicago are some of the most aggressive panhandlers I've ever encountered in my trips across the US(this isn't really the hostels problem more of a warning to people staying there, the area is extremely safe but just stay aware). Also a small warning since I recommend public transit due to it being so developed and close to the hostel, be mindful that due to COVID-19 there are driver shortages so the buses/trains might be delayed more specifically the buses are effected by this so be mindful.
Positive Reviews:
It was a nice place to stay there were pretty extensive safety measures. Such as, you had to keycard swipe to even get to the elevator hallway then once in the elevators you have to swipe your card again to select your floor and once you get to your room you have to swipe to enter the room. Also after hours they lock the side doors and you have to enter in through the main door which also is keycard protected and if you don't have a keycard you have to be buzzed in through the speaker. It made me feel very safe considering I was traveling alone, I visited a friends hotel in Chicago and walked straight up to her room and no one stopped or questioned me. The full service kitchen is pretty nice but due to COVID-19 the utensils/plates are disposable and you have to bring your own pots/pans/cooking utensils so keep that in mind. You do have to request a blanket at the front desk but you can do so at any point in your trip. The lockers are also larger than I expected I was able to fit a medium sized suitcase and my backpack in it and I still had some wiggle room. Don't forget to bring your own lock for the lockers.

Also due to it's location downtown right next to the raised L-train tracks, it is within walking distance to a lot of cool stores, tourist places, restaurants, and if you don't feel like walking far the bus stops and boarding stations for the L train are all within a 3-4 minute walk of the front door. I recommend downloading the transit apps(I think one is just called transit and the other in ventra)/using google maps and then buying day passes for the public transit because it'll give you unlimited rides on buses/trains for however many days you choose.

Negative Reviews: the building all the facilitations and the very friendly employees, except for a lady who, due to a misunderstanding, knocked on my room door 3 times a night and at that time she wanted me to go down to the administration and she was the only one who had a bad attitude with us I treat them like liars. I felt that they were going to take me out of the hotel, but everything else was very good.

Review Title: GREAT location to stay at in Chicago! ill most certaintly be back in the future! Thanks for such a g
Negative Reviews: The rooms were a tad bit chilly. But using both of the blankets they provided us with helped a lot and made for a cozy night's sleep. Just make sure to bring socks and warm clothes if you're staying here in the winter, just in case!
Positive Reviews:
This was the PERFECT hostel for a weekend in Chicago with my boyfriend. We spent 3 nights here and are so glad we did! We stayed in a private room, and it was very spacious with a closet and hangers. The bathroom was right down the hall and had shampoo, conditioner, soap AND towels. This place had the best location EVER to walk anywhere or take a bus/train to any of the museums. The beds and pillows were comfy, the rooms were quiet (besides the trains outside). Nothing that earplugs couldn't fix though! All the staff were friendly. The hostel felt secure and safe, and you get a keycard to unlock every room. This hostel had a nice and cozy vibe here and was the perfect place to hang, play pool or ping pong! They also offer free coffee and granola bars in the morning, which was a really nice touch. They also have a lot of vending machines as well. There are also lockers/storage (free of charge) while you walk around the city! Just make sure to bring your own lock to lock the lockers. You really get the best bang for your buck here!

Thanks for such a great stay! We'll for sure be staying here when we come back to Chicago.

Review Title: I felt unsafe during my stay.
Negative Reviews:
I recently stayed at HI Chicago and unfortunately had a concerning experience regarding security, particularly for women. During my last night there, a man continuously knocked on the door of my female-only dorm room. Despite another female guest answering the door, explaining that it was a female dorm, the man persisted, claiming the room was his. He appeared intoxicated and made himself at home without removing his shoes.

This incident occurred late at night, leaving me feeling extremely vulnerable and unsafe. I was worried about the possibility of assault, not just for myself but for other female guests as well. Thankfully, another guest sought help from the lobby staff, who eventually removed the intruder from the room. However, the lack of communication from the staff about the situation only added to our distress.

As a result of this experience, I cannot in good conscience recommend HI to anyone, especially women. It's imperative that the security system at HI, particularly in female dormitories, be improved to prevent similar incidents in the future. Guests deserve to feel secure and protected during their stay, and this incident fell far short of that expectation.

I urge HI to take immediate action to address these security concerns and ensure the safety of all guests. Transparency and communication are key in situations like these, and I hope to see improvements in these areas going forward.

Negative Reviews:
Staff was not helpful at checking in at all. Stairs up to reception so had to carry my suitcase.
Biggest problem was the noise - my room overlooked the L train and the metal tracks are really loud late into the night whenever a train goes through. Even with earplugs I could still hear it and barely slept.

Wi-Fi (the signal was disappearing all the time) and, above all - breakfast. If you do offer a breakfast to your patrons, make sure: 

- there is enough food for those who come to eat at 7 am and 9:30 am. The quantity of food must be based on the number of people staying at the hostel at the time.
- fix your amenities fast. The coffee machine was broken for two out of my three days of staying

- change filters in your water station. If you promote sustainability, then make sure ppl can have access to clean filtered water

First of all, they charge an extra $4 per night for some kind of membership even if you are fully paid on booking. 
They provide lockers but no locks. Be prepared to shell out an extra $11 or bring your own
Besides your bed they provide 2 small towels, a fitted sheet (you must put it on the bed yourself) and a thin linen sheet. No quilt, comforter, duvet, or in general anything to keep you even slightly warm. Plus, the room was quite cold. Be prepared to sleep, as I did, fully clothed with a sweatshirt and socks on.
I don't know if there is an accepted good time to spend a half hour cleaning the showers and not letting anyone in the bathroom, but 08:30 AM, i.e. when most people are getting up and taking showers, is probably not it. 
Aside from that, there are always the usual hostel problems, like the guy who wakes up at 07:30 and and starts whistling

Review Title: Worst hostel I have stayed in in North America
Negative Reviews:
The staff at the front desk were very unhelpful. My bunkbed did not have any linens, towels or blankets when I checked in at 4pm. I asked the woman working the front desk to provide me with some, she said housekeeping would bring me some straight away. An hour later I had to ask the front desk a second time, still no linens. I  had to ask a third time after 8pm and insist that they find me some linens, even though "housekeeping had already left for the day".

Blanket provided was made of sticky plastic/Styrofoam. Bathroom was not clean, room (floor) was only cleaned on request.

No shelves next to bunks, nowhere to keep your phone, charger, earplugs etc. No hooks in rooms to hang your jacket, towel etc.

Big rooms with very sparce furniture, look extremely lifeless/charmless.

People managing and working in the Hostel clearly do not know and/or do not care what guest need and want from a hostel. I suspect they have trouble finding staff.

the air vent in the room made extreme noise, and I am usually a very easy sleeper, but this was sleep depriving.

Review Title: Overrated, the only plus is the location and price compared to hotels.
Negative Reviews:
Don't understand the high rating of this hostel... The aircon is on full blast, everyone asked for an additional blanket at reception because it was freezing and I twice left to sit in a café because I was too cold in the common areas. There is also a weird smell inside the building, and no fresh air coming into the rooms (only one window in the room I stayed in).
They overcharged me for the hostel membership as it's $4/night or $18/year. No one explained that so I ended up paying $24 for the 6 nights that I stayed. Compared to other hostels this is overpriced, compared to hotels in Chicago this is the only cheap option. 
You also have to lock up all your stuff into tiny lockers so that nothing gets stolen and they don't provide any locks for use/rent so you have to buy one.
Positive Reviews:
The only reason I stayed here is because of the price and the location. I needed to stay downtown for a course and didn't want to pay $3'000 for a week so I booked here. The location is very central and you can walk to downtown. 
The bunk beds were robust and had curtains for privacy which was good.

Review Title: The WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE I have EVER experienced.
Negative Reviews:
Long story short, they were totally unable to work together with me as a customer to provide a reliable solution for a mistake that was both sides' fault.

I booked a bed in a shared room to stay during my trip for a Coldplay concert in Chicago, I received the confirmation of the booking almost a week before. I was so excited that I did not pay attention to the details on it and that was my biggest mistake. The day I arrived, right there at the counter waiting to check in I noticed that the booking says "Male shared room" so I told the front desk guy and he immediately told me that that was a big mistake from my side and that they were fully booked. the thing was that they only offered separate rooms for females and males and there was no more female room available to change me, so his only solution was to give a refund. I told him that for me it was not a problem to stay in a male room as most of the hostels around the world that I had stayed in offer mixed rooms. but he keed saying no, I almost begged him to call his boss to see if he will offer me a better solution considering that they also committed a mistake when they didn't notice as well once they sent me the confirmation of the booking and his answer was that my name was weird and hard to tell if it was a female or a male name (My name is Luz) I haven't met a guy with my name in my entire life and anyways I found his comment a little stupid.  After a few minutes of asking and begging for help I just gave up, I felt so lost and disappointed, they did not offer me any aside solution, no help, ANYTHING AT ALL!, not even a map or a recommendation of a different place to stay. I looked for a place for that night and then I ASKED THEM if there was room for me for the next two days because it was a 3-day reservation and they were full just for that night, just then he says yes but my question was... why he did not offer me that solution before?.
Positive Reviews: The Hostel, in general, is really good but they should pay attention to their staff and the kind of customer service and customer care that they provide.

Positive Reviews: The location was nice

Negative Reviews: The Elevated train is right next to the hostel, so it was a bit noisy on the first night, but I got used to it by the second night.
Positive Reviews: The 4-bed female dorm on Level 5 had everything I needed. Each bed had a light, power supply and a good sized locker (remember to bring a padlock). My 4-bed dorm shared a kitchen, living room, shower and toilet, with another 4-bed female dorm. That was enough for 8 as most people don't hang around. There's also a communal shower and toilet on Level 5 for anyone to use. It wasn't until I left that I noticed that level 2 has a library, communal games/leisure area and a big kitchen. Perhaps the facilities on level 2 should be advertised more widely. When I checked out I was able to store my luggage in the lockers on ground floor (needed that padlock again). The Cafecito café on the ground floor is great, friendly staff and good food. I'll stay at HI Chicago again any day.

Review Title: It is a convenient space, but its service needs substantial improvement.
Negative Reviews: The beds are not set properly after checking out. When I checked in, I could not find blanket on my bed, so I had to go downstairs to the front desk to ask one. What's more, when my roommate checked in on 16th, he found his bed messy, on which the blanket was not folded up, and a cigarette end under his bed. After telling this to the receptionist, I received perfunctory answer; the receptionist told me that no one checked out from my room, while my previous roommate took away all of his belongings and my new roommate entered his bedroom with room card sent from reception desk; also, the receptionist answered my questions above by asking me to ask my new roommate to talk to them in person. Not surprisingly, I saw no change to that bed - the bed was still messy, and the cigarette kept staying there. The access control on bedroom door was troublesome; there has already been an access control on the entrance to our living room, so another access control is necessary. Once I forgot my card after taking shower, and I had to run downstairs with no clothes on me; I was looking for a telephone or communicator, but there was not. There was no free breakfast provided in this hostel, while the cafe on the first floor, owned by this hostel, was still open and crowded with guests in this hostel. The WiFi is poor in my room; it sometimes stopped working without reason, so I had to switch to my mobile data.
Positive Reviews: It is located in the Loop, with subway stations in minutes walk, and Millennium Park in 10 minutes walk,so it is pretty convenient. The doors, from front gate, gate to elevator lobby, to bedroom doors all require card to enter. There is a shower room and toilet in the bedroom, so guests do not need to go to the public shower room or restroom.

Negative Reviews: Due to the location being in downtown there are a lot of sirens at random hours of the night and the building is right next to the raised L-train tracks so if you're a light sleeper then maybe bring some earplugs or headphones, it didn't personally bother me but I know it might bother some people. Also due to it being downtown there are a few homeless people who roam around along that street, the hostel does a very good job of keeping them away from and outside of the hostel but if you aren't prepared the homeless people in Chicago are some of the most aggressive panhandlers I've ever encountered in my trips across the US(this isn't really the hostels problem more of a warning to people staying there, the area is extremely safe but just stay aware). Also a small warning since I recommend public transit due to it being so developed and close to the hostel, be mindful that due to COVID-19 there are driver shortages so the buses/trains might be delayed more specifically the buses are effected by this so be mindful.
Positive Reviews:
It was a nice place to stay there were pretty extensive safety measures. Such as, you had to keycard swipe to even get to the elevator hallway then once in the elevators you have to swipe your card again to select your floor and once you get to your room you have to swipe to enter the room. Also after hours they lock the side doors and you have to enter in through the main door which also is keycard protected and if you don't have a keycard you have to be buzzed in through the speaker. It made me feel very safe considering I was traveling alone, I visited a friends hotel in Chicago and walked straight up to her room and no one stopped or questioned me. The full service kitchen is pretty nice but due to COVID-19 the utensils/plates are disposable and you have to bring your own pots/pans/cooking utensils so keep that in mind. You do have to request a blanket at the front desk but you can do so at any point in your trip. The lockers are also larger than I expected I was able to fit a medium sized suitcase and my backpack in it and I still had some wiggle room. Don't forget to bring your own lock for the lockers.

Also due to it's location downtown right next to the raised L-train tracks, it is within walking distance to a lot of cool stores, tourist places, restaurants, and if you don't feel like walking far the bus stops and boarding stations for the L train are all within a 3-4 minute walk of the front door. I recommend downloading the transit apps(I think one is just called transit and the other in ventra)/using google maps and then buying day passes for the public transit because it'll give you unlimited rides on buses/trains for however many days you choose.

Negative Reviews: the building all the facilitations and the very friendly employees, except for a lady who, due to a misunderstanding, knocked on my room door 3 times a night and at that time she wanted me to go down to the administration and she was the only one who had a bad attitude with us I treat them like liars. I felt that they were going to take me out of the hotel, but everything else was very good.

Review Title: GREAT location to stay at in Chicago! ill most certaintly be back in the future! Thanks for such a g
Negative Reviews: The rooms were a tad bit chilly. But using both of the blankets they provided us with helped a lot and made for a cozy night's sleep. Just make sure to bring socks and warm clothes if you're staying here in the winter, just in case!
Positive Reviews:
This was the PERFECT hostel for a weekend in Chicago with my boyfriend. We spent 3 nights here and are so glad we did! We stayed in a private room, and it was very spacious with a closet and hangers. The bathroom was right down the hall and had shampoo, conditioner, soap AND towels. This place had the best location EVER to walk anywhere or take a bus/train to any of the museums. The beds and pillows were comfy, the rooms were quiet (besides the trains outside). Nothing that earplugs couldn't fix though! All the staff were friendly. The hostel felt secure and safe, and you get a keycard to unlock every room. This hostel had a nice and cozy vibe here and was the perfect place to hang, play pool or ping pong! They also offer free coffee and granola bars in the morning, which was a really nice touch. They also have a lot of vending machines as well. There are also lockers/storage (free of charge) while you walk around the city! Just make sure to bring your own lock to lock the lockers. You really get the best bang for your buck here!

Thanks for such a great stay! We'll for sure be staying here when we come back to Chicago.

Review Title: Many pros, but the beds make the place not worth it
Negative Reviews: THE BEDS. I have never been to jail, but I would imagine a jail bed feels like this. The first night I barely slept and debated just finding another hotel. To be fair, I’ve never stayed at a hostel before, so I do not know if this is typical, but I’m moving to Chicago and doing a lot of back and forth traveling, so I needed a good price.  My back was sore and my whole body ached every morning (I am 35) as did my 14 year old daughter, who also barely slept. To me, the bed is a deal breaker, and I need a comfortable and good night’s rest. For this reason alone, I wouldn’t return. If they could improve the quality of their mattresses, I’d definitely come back!
